Articles.Content:
Im planning on regressing myself to fly with mechjeb again, but with a catch. Im not using any of the autopilots, and flying in IVA the whole time. Utilizing the node creation and flight data to fly, and land on the moon.

One of the problems I have with this is, I can't seem to find a way (if there is a way) to select targets without going to map view OR right clicking them in normal view. (such as in a docking situation)

This doesn't matter as much when i want to just land anywhere on the moon, but it does matter if i want to land close to a target and need its coordinates and data.

I know Kerbal Engineer can select targets via buttons, and was wonderin if MJ has something similar hidden away somewhere or even has that functionality.

Are you using RasterPropMonitor? It's got a target selection screen on one of the pages. Haven't used it for targeting landed things so I don't know what info it gives regarding that, but it'll be targeted all the same.

No, i could potentially get the mod for what im doing just to make things a little more user friendly in IVA. I probably will if there is not function or minor add on to give mechjeb the ability to set up targets without map or outside views.
I haven't seen anything that does exactly what you want, but in addition to RasterPropMonitor, you might be interested in the ALCOR lander.
